result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremiah L Schlei was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called at 9:16 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Jeremiah L Schlei appears via video, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek, who appears in Court. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Upon agreement of parties, Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient but notes garbled incoming audio
Atty Svehlek informs the Court that the restitution has been resolved:
 - $1397 - Crime Victim Services
 - $23,584 - Department of Justice
 - $24,981 - Total

ADA Hall indicates that they will not be seeking any additional amounts in restitution
Atty Svehlek informs the Court that she has not been able to discuss amounts with Mr. Schlei
Mr. Schlei informs parties that he agrees with restitution amount
Upon questioning of the Court re: proceeding or needing additional/private time with client - Mr. Schlei indicates they can proceed
Atty Svehlek stipulates to restitution amount - Court orders $24,981 in restitution.
Arguments presented by Atty Svehlek re: ability to pay
ADA Hall submits supporting documents regarding restitution; Arguments by ADA Hall re: ability to pay

Jeremiah Schlei--sworn & testifies
--direct exam by Atty Svehlek
--cross exam by ADA Hall
Arguments by Counsel
Court presents basis and determines that Mr. Schlei can pay $400 per month towards restitution beginning the second month of supervision. Agent is authorized to collect more, if deemed Mr. Schlei has the ability to pay more. 
Recess: 9:54 am

records.addlTxt:
Cases 14CF2 & 14CT42 called together at 2:43 pm
Defendant Jeremiah L Schlei in court, in-custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek. DA Susan V Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
14CF2: Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Schlei waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information; Arraignment:--service of Information admitted, reading waived

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1-14CT42 & to charge in 14CF2; factual basis stipulated; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court amends the information to reflect Village of Johnson Creek rather than Town of Aztalan
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2-14CT42

14CF2: Court sentences Mr. Schlei to 2 years & 3 months, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1 year and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 15 months. This sentence is to commence consecutive to any other sentence in being 

The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program. 
The Court gives 1 day credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--No acts/threats of violence towards anyone
--AODA Assessment & Follow-through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--No possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as per Agent
--To pay costs of $268
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--No Contact with Jamie Proffitt or be present at his place of employment, residence or education
--Restitution - TBD
--To pay 10% restitution processing fee - TBD

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
Restitution held open and hearing to be set

14CT42: On Count #1, the Court sentences the Defendant: 
--To serve 5 months in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence consecutive to any previously imposed sentence - to be served in the prison system
--Days credit for time already served: 0 days
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process
--To pay fine of $1200 + costs = $2252 + $200 DNA Surcharge = $2452 + $56.74 blood testing fee (JESO)= $2508.74; due in $50 increments per month beginning 5/31/18 and on the last day of the month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment will result in 90 days in jail with Huber privileges, consecutive
--Revocation of drivers license for 27 months
--County alcohol/drug assessment ordered
--Victim impact panel attendance
--Ignition Interlock Device requirement/restrictions for: 27 months
--6 demerit points assessed
Defense does not object to Def. appearing by video for restitution hearing
off-recrord: 3:19 - 3:20 pm 
Court announces date for the record
Recess: 3:20 pm

Case called at 1:46 pm
Defendant Jeremiah L Schlei in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court verifies with the defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint are correct.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Court reviewed the criminal complaint and finds that it states probable cause.
Attorney De La Rosa informs the Court that the defendant qualifies for SPD representation.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $2,500.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-No acts or threats of violence  
-No contact with Jamie Proffitt

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 

Recess: 1:50 pm
